page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: {FLORA AND FAUNA }Wild flowers proliferate on clifftops and greenswards. They include gorse, vetch, mallow, varieties of thistle, bell heather, Cornish heath and golden samphire. Birdlife includes Shags, Curlews, Jackdaws, Buzzards, Cormorants, Razor Bills, Oyster Catchers, a variety of Gulls, Pewits, Wheatears and many Larks. Seals are regularly seen. {FOOTPATHS }The area is freely accessible by footpaths, including the Coastal Footpath. Overwalking on flanking greensward is seriously scarring the more accessible places. {CLIMATE AND WEATHER }The area has a mild climate but with tendency to high winds. The prevailing wind is SW, but in winter, spells from the N and E. Trevose Head is popularly supposed to make this a low rainfall area.
